Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Kelly C
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 3 girls visiting Amsterdam, very friendly staff, who happily locked our luggage in a safe room when we arrived early (and on departure) comfy well equiped rooms, which were clean and we loved the decoration. Would deffinately recommend to anyone travelling to Amsterdam, I would not hesitate to return and stay with friends or with family.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel well recommended”
Reviews.Author: Flounder40
Reviews.Content: Gret place for exploring and enjoying Amsterdam. Have had better breakfasts but it was good enough. Room was v Good- shower did leak onto floor a bit but it was a minor niggle. Free safe, quiet despite location and the easiest hotel to get to. Wide staircase (for the dam) and lift access Would go back with no problems

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay, modern hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: RachP93
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 11am knowing the room wasnt available until 2pm but thought we'd check if our room was ready, it wasn't but they have a luggage store so you can get rid of it. The hotel was very modern and welcoming, bar and breakfast area with an open fire was lovely. We had room number 43 at the very top of the hotel with a little veranda. Memory foam mattress, chairs and table, en suite. Decorated lovely with a huge plasma television. Definately request this room if possible!! Location was very good, 5 minutes from Centraal Station even though we didnt know where we were going and went the long way it only took us 20 minutes. About 10 minutes from Dam Square, 20 minutes to the Red Light District (which you have to go and have a look at!), 10 minutes to Spuis which is full of lovely little restaurants. There are a few restaurants right by the hotel although I dont know what these were like as we didnt eat there. Overall we had a lovely trip, we didnt pay much so went with low expectations but were extremely pleased witht the quality and service we received. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with a few drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: Dohfar
Reviews.Content: This is essentially a good hotel and should really get four stars, but it has a few problems that drag it down a bit. That said, I would happily stay there again. GOOD POINTS - Good location in central Amsterdam: 5min walk from Centraal station, 10min walk to Dam Square, 15mins on tram to Rijksmuseum - Lots of restaurants and cafes nearby, good supermarket short walk away (Albert Heijn in Nieuwendijk, first left after leaving hotel) - Clean, fair-sized room with good quality furnishings - Free wi-fi or use of internet terminal (within certain limits) - Helpful, laid-back staff DRAWBACKS - A slight lack of maintenance in room: unreliable safe, shower not working properly, sink slow to drain - Daft colour scheme - black furniture, black wooden floors, black/gold curtains, dark walls - gives the hotel a sombre air - Bed mattress very very soft with no support for back - So-so breakfast served in cramped area next to reception - Seedy area after dark in Spuistraat and surrounding streets - although you can avoid this by walking along the parallel Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal

Reviews.Title: “Had a great trip!”
Reviews.Author: Bladette1981
Reviews.Content: Having been to Amsterdam almost 10 years ago i decided to book a surprise trip for 3 nights in Jan as a Xmas pressie fr my other half and to have two friends accompany us. I had been warned that drink prices had gone up to about Â£7 a pint but was pleasently surprised that on entering the hotel they did cans of 330ml for 2 euro!! there was no reception at this hotel you just go to the bar and unfortunately the hotel doesnt do any food (apart from the inclusive brekfast) but it was a lovely hotel. we booked via alpharooms and we had room 44 and our friends had room 23 0 we paid the same for the stay (Â£200 a couple) and comparitively our room wasnt as good value for money as they had more frills and a much larger bathroom. but our room was adequate and warm being on the top floor - also the lift was a great help!! i would definately recommend this hotel. the staff were helpful, breakkie was better than expected and it was in a great location. we had some lovely food at the two italians (with your back to hotel, walk upwards and take your first left - they were both on your right, and at a restaurant called something like 1854 - turn left our of main door and walk back down on yourself and it was on the right hand side) so it was only a short walk back to the hotel. we also liked the irish pub (in between the two italians) and there was a genuine irish barmaid! the hotel was quiet at night - you can hear the tram slightly but didnt really bother us. if you are looking for a clean, budget hotel in a central location this is it!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: SussexHoney
Reviews.Content: Having walked out of our originally booked hotel - which was awful, we found the Sint Nicolaas, we were given a lovely room looking out to the town, the room was spotless, bathroom large with plenty of boiling hot water and again very clean, the staff could not have been anymore helpful from the gentleman who showed us our room down to the night security guard. The breakfast was also very good you could eat as much as you wanted. The reception/bar area had a great roaring fire which made the whole atmosphere so friendly. Every room was given a bottle of champagne to celebrate New Year - nice touch. The rate was good, it included breakfast and tax and was less money than the 'awful' hotel which did not include either of these items, it was only a few minutes walk from all the celebrations of New Year, we would 100% recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: council_worker
Reviews.Content: We had no problems with anything during our stay here. The rooms were big enough, the breakfast was good, the location excellent and the service brilliant. The beds were amongst the best hotel rooms we have stayed in. What more can I say?

Reviews.Title: “Three friends on a girls weekend”
Reviews.Author: NorskiFrankrike
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the good reviews on trip advisor. It was only 5 minutes walk from the central train station (where the train from the airport arrives). Funky modern decor, lots of black and silver. The reception area has comfy sofas and a roaring fire, breakfast area and computers with internet connection. Our room (number 11) was a three person room on the first floor, decorated mostly in black which looked nice but with the poor lighting made it difficult to see anything! The bathroom was a little in need of upgrading but acceptable. Breakfast (included in the price) was continental style with a good selection of fresh food and very good coffee. All the staff were very helpful and friendly and spoke perfect english. They were happy to help with maps and suggestions for sightseeing, restaurants etc. The location is about ten minutes walk from Dam square, main shopping areas, picturesque streets and canals etc. All in all a good location for a city centre break.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: kittridge
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my experience at the Hotel Sint Nicolaas. The room was great and a decent size for Europe. The bed was comfy. I was on the third floor which was purple and had photos of Marilyn Monroe in the hall and in my room. Each floor had a different decor. The hotel staff were really great as well. They helped us book a fantastic dinner cruise and were always friendly and welcomed us with a smile and a hello at all hours of the day. The breakfast was great (and included which is key) and served until 10 am. The location couldn't be better. A main walking street that takes you right to The Dam is two seconds away from the hotel. Central Station is also about a 5 minute walk which is super convenient if you're taking the train in and/or out of the city like we were. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family hotel”
Reviews.Author: 12345jab
Reviews.Content: Small family hotel in a beautiful location in the heart of Amsterdam. 4-beds room was small, clean and comfortable. Breakfast was sufficient and the staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish but not great for a couple in a triple”
Reviews.Author: marinadelmar
Reviews.Content: This is a very stylish, if dark, hotel. The continental breakfast was very good. On the downside, we were in a triple and the double bed were two singles pushed together which wasn't conducive to snuggling. The bedside lamp was very dim - bring a reading light if you like to read in bed. The first night we were in another room (triple wasn't available yet), where I woke up with a bug bite. The worst was finding the maid's master key on my son's bed and wondering how often that happens - we could have cleaned out lots of rooms if we weren't the moral upstanding citizens we are.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the "Double" Rooms on the 4th Floor!”
Reviews.Author: millsnp
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel Sint Nicolaas before, a few years ago, but never on the 4th floor. The "double" rooms on the 4th floor are small with barely enough room for 2 people. I did ask for a room change but was informed this was not possible. The only positive point for Hotel Sint Nicolaas was the central location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff - Minutes from Train Station”
Reviews.Author: Shannon1966
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful at this small hotel. We had a large family room on the top floor which had four single beds which were very comfortable. We took the train in and out of Amsterdam and the hotel is an easy few minute walk to the station.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and would bring the family back”
Reviews.Author: Ragrunberg
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights, my husband and myself and 17 year old daughter shared a 3 person room. The room was fantastic, a good size with a lovely and clean bathroom including a bath. My only negative is the room was a bit warm and opening the window let in a lot of noise from the trams. We walked with our luggage from the station no problem. The handy tram access was useful for when we ventured into the museum district or to the cheap eateries in the noisy part of town. The room was quiet despite trams. Lots of coffeeshops close by which didn't interest us but didn't get in our way either. Some cheap cafes close by but also some pricey ones so look at menus and head toward the smaller streets and laneways. Breakfast was a typical continental which filled us up well. Loved the decor. Will come back if in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “10 out of 10”
Reviews.Author: BCtravelerette
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I went to a 10 day trips in May visiting Frankfurt, Paris, and Amsterdam. After experienced the shabby and tiny 3-star hotel rooms in Paris and Frankfurt, we didn't have high hopes for Hotel Sint Nicolaas. But wow, what a nice surprise. The room was "huge", classy, with fresh paint and modern finishing in the bathroom. Although the windows were facing the Voorburgwal street, the room is well sound proofed once the window is closed. There was a safe in the closet for customers' convenience. The location is great, a short five minute walk from the central train station and the major habor for canal cruises. Free Wifi and the complimentary breakfast buffet was good, offering fruit salad, cold meet/cheese slices, vegetables, pastries, juices and coffee. The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful. At the night before our departure, we checked with the front desk if we may had some breakfast earlier next morning as we need to leave around 5:30am. He said it may be difficult as the stuff serving breakfast only start working at 7am. Then in the morning when we came down to the lobby at 5:40am, he has already set out most of the breakfast items for us all by himself. We were deeply touched. This nice gesture just made the perfect end to our trip. Thank you, Hotel Sint Nicolaas. We will defintely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: JuFalk
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I've ever been. The room was not clean, the air conditioning was not working and the noise of the tram, all the night , was terrible. And we had to pay for in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent... except one offensive night-shift front desk attendant”
Reviews.Author: rmode
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Loved the atmosphere. Very old-world. Distinctive. Have stayed in Amsterdam 3x in the last 6 months, and this has been my favorite hotel. One exception to the excellence.... there was a front-desk attendant on one night-shift who was a total jerk. For 3 days, I was getting coffee from the lobby coffee machine, and the only thing that I ever got from the staff was warm smiles. Then, one night, I went to get a coffee (as I did for the past 3 days), and this jerk attacked me insisting that I give him 2 euro on the spot. This was petty. The 2 euro was insignificant, it was just the gross unprofessionalism and offensiveness that this guy behaved with. I payed almost $1000 usd for a hotel stay. Maybe the guy could have let the cup of coffee slide. Or let me know next time he'll have to charge me. Even asking for the 2 euro in a non-aggressive way would have been ok. Instead he went into total attack mode, and got in my face over a petty cup of coffee. This guy is a liability to this Hotel. If they fired him, they would have a better operation. When I first saw him, I thought it was a homeless tramp warming up in the lobby. Then he started this nonsense. He was a small Asian man. The rest of the staff was exemplary.

Reviews.Title: “never book this hotel”
Reviews.Author: rezaeian
Reviews.Content: the heating was off when the weather was 4 c ,,,

Reviews.Title: “compact, clean, tidy, friendly, great location.”
Reviews.Author: nursegraeme
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Amsterdam for a long weekend, for the first time, we had researched as usual. Hotel Sint Nicholaas turned out to be a good choice, The train station is easily accessible at the airport and trains run every 10minutes to Amsterdam central. We bought return tickets which was easy to do, We had down loaded directions from Amsterdam central to hotel Sint Nicholass, which was very easy to follow, probably took about 15 minutes to walk to the hotel, You have to learn to do your green cross code in reverse, there are hundreds of cyclists, plus trams, cars and taxi's so you need to be alert The hotel staff where very helpful, we had a room on the fourth floor, which was small, but clean and tidy, we couldn't operate the room safe, I informed the staff at reception and he came immediately and fixed it, its use is free. The breakfast was a typical continental, we found it quite substantial, We could hear the trams running by when we had the window open, and not too bad when the window was closed, this hotel is very central so it is to be expected, but did not bother us, we had a flat screen t.v which got bbc1 and itv, the the tram frequency lessened as the evening went on, I don't know if they ran through the night because once we where asleep nothing woke us. There was free use of the internet, we didn't use it but other guests did. We did a lot of walking, visited Ann Franks house, very moving, a couple of art galleries, the flower market is worth a visit, Lots of tulip bulbs, The red light district is worth a visit, the girls seemed friendly, waving at me, good for the ego, I had read you are not to photograph the girls, I saw one young man doing this and when the girl saw him she went banana's banging on the window, In truth you can see more on a beach than you do here, On the whole the hotel is well situated, they have a room to store your luggage when you check out if you are not going straight to the airport and want to do some last minute sight seeing, our flight wasn't until late in the evening, so we went to one of the parks and got some rays as the sun was out.

Reviews.Title: “would go back and would recomend to friends”
Reviews.Author: sueandglen
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel great situation the normal noise you get in amsterdam but we were not bothered by the trams at all rooms really nice and clean, hotel staff very helpful would go back again have been to amsterdam before and stayed just down the road and can honestly say that this hotel was 10 times better by far

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: darrylstott1
Reviews.Content: Having read hundreds of reviews here for different hotels we finally settled upon this one. The hotel has a great location, 5 minutes walk to central station and on a great tram line. The rooms are stylish, perhaps a tad faded but not to the point of disappointing. The bathroom was very well presented too. Beds were very comfortable, but in a triple room facing the tramline, placing a bed under the window made for a noisier than normal night of sleep, again not to the point of disruption. Breakfast was a continental affair, well presented and included in the room price. Staff were very helpful, English speaking and played well to our sense of humour. Overall an enjoyable stay, the location was perfect and the experience very good. If you're struggling to decide and the price is right, go for this one, chances are you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: MicheBud
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in February 2011 with my partner and we couldn't have asked for a better hotel and location. Just across from the train station down Spuistraat, this easily reached Centre Hotel has everything you need. Extremely helpful and friendly staff. Warm cosy rooms with opening windows if required. Air con, Plenty of electric sockets, full length mirrors, room safe, alarm clock, nice shower, soap dispensers in shower and next to wash basin, remote TV with plenty of English speaking channels. Surprisingly quiet for location and got a good nights sleep. Cleaner came every day to replace towels/bedding and clean room. Breakfast was continental buffet. Downstairs had a bar, a big open fire, large TV and 3 PC's which are very convenient when you need to check in on line for your return flights. (Staff will print off your boarding passes.) There is free wifi here too. On checking out at 11am you can have your luggage ticketed and kept safe in a locked storeroom for free till you need to collect them again. We will definitely return soon. Top Tip: If you like designer labels,take a 15 minute train to Haarlem for the best shopping experience ever and Willie Wortles Coffee Shop is recommended. Back in Amsterdam, try Gartine (locally recommended), a great place to eat lunch, it is at Taksteeg 7, everything is made from fresh produce from their own greenhouse, even their eggs are from their own hens. You are better booking on 020-320 41 32. At Gartine I had the tastiest soup ever. The Xtracold Ice Bar is a must and you get 3 free drinks incl in the entry fee (xtracold.com). If you want to visit Anne Franks House, buy your fast track tickets on line and beat the long queues. I found buying tickets for attractions on line saves you money.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is beautiful, charming, clean and staffed with the kindest of the kind!”
Reviews.Author: sorrento728
Reviews.Content: Sint Nicolaas is within walking distance of Centraal Station. It is situated btween 2 side streets yet the room we were in was super-quiet. The bathroom was modern and came well equipped, including hair dryer! The complimentary breakfast was excellent. Free use of 3 laptops in lobby was nice bonus. Bed was incredibly comfortable! Green, eco-friendly feature was room key had to be inserted into slot to turn on lights. The staff was genuinely kind in making your stay comfortable and happy-very helpful in all areas. Such a gorgeous hotel within the city attractions~it really gave us a taste of traditional Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: JMichelle89
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very easy to find, its located near Central Station, prob like a 5 to 10 minute walk and its pretty much in the dead centre of Amsterdam. The hotel has a very nice comfortable vibe to it and the staff is great!! Extremely helpful and nice. Rooms are quite big and comfy, and the price/quality was very good. Big breakfast each morning and also unlimited free (!) acces to WiFi... Definitely going to stay here again for my next visit to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER book this hotel”
Reviews.Author: steveafa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the main railway station but that is the only plus we had. Our stay was very short because I had to find another hotel for our weekend trip in Amsterdam. Upon our arrival the room was on the top floor 4th where the heating was off. Took us almost 5 hours to heat up the room a bit othewise we sould be sleeping in pulovers. Internet was not working, guys on the desk were not even a bit helpful. Elevator was going only to the 3rd floor for some reason broke down and we had to carry the luggadge by to the 4th floor in a very steep and narrow corridor. Rooms on the pictures look nice actually i got the room that was on the web page but i can promise you it is very bad when you see it ....

Reviews.Title: “We would love to stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: kaydc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sint Nicolaas for 3 nights. I can't say enough for the helpfulness and friendliness of the staff, especially Daan who went out of his way for us and recommended a wonderful typical Dutch restaurant in the vicinity. The room was comfortable and spotless, and there is free wifi throughout the hotel. We enjoyed having a drink at the fireside in the lobby, and the continental breakfast offered a wide variety of good choices. The location is ideal for touring on day trips by train since it's only a short walk from the station. There are lots of good and varied restaurants in the area and most of the sights of Amsterdam are within easy walking distance. The room was hot but we opened the window for a while before going to bed and slept comfortably.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MazzaOwen
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a fanastic break in Amsterdam I feel the need to write a positive review about the Hotel Sint Nicolaas. Firstly, the bad reviews about this hotel can no longer be justified as my husband and I found the rooms to be clean, spacious, nicely decorated and comfortable (a far cry from the previous reviews). I believe that the hotel has been recently renovated and actions have been made by all staff to promote very good standards and a friendly atmosphere. The breakfast was fresh and filling and the hotel location can not be beaten (3 mins walk from station). Will stay again if we return to Amsterdam in the future. Great staff, great little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near the train station”
Reviews.Author: BadenBilly
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and would recommend this hotel. The staff was exceptionally helpful (thanks Jos and Daan) in making reservations, calling taxis etc. The rooms have recently been renovated and are clean and comfortable. They provide a good breakfast, high speed internet access and good location for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “would go back again in a flash”
Reviews.Author: tanlouBallyclare
Reviews.Content: brill place to stay. very clean. very friendly staff. lovely room. even the towels & sheets were changed on a regular basis. couldn't falter the place at all. I was very apprehensive about going after reading the reviews on this site. but total contrast. i believe most of the rooms have been refurbished. very spotless. we even had a drink in the bar at night & the barmen kept giving us nuts "cause we were still drinking!!" where else would you get the friendless like that in a city hotel :-)

Reviews.Title: “Don't!”
Reviews.Author: packet68
Reviews.Content: I usually don't write reviews and this is my first one but I had to do this. The problem with this hotel is the location between two very NOISY streets (you can get only one side or the other; doesn't make much difference) - you will not get a good night sleep. Also no AC or fridge in the room (forget the ice maker, had to go to reception every time to get some). I asked about the refrigerators and was told that they are very expensive (ok?!). It happened to be very hot in Amsterdam and I had to keep windows open all times listening to traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “nightmare!!!!”
Reviews.Author: appleverde
Reviews.Content: I just have to say one thing: I foundstains of blood on the toilet. So disgusting....

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: RyanC7
Reviews.Content: We paid for the location. Room was not so great. Central to most everything though.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, Friendly Staff,... :)”
Reviews.Author: Ghadark
Reviews.Content: Best Location, Friendly Staff :) I loved this hotel, I would recommend to stay again also the hotel was a good value of money, perfect location 3 mins from Central Station. The room was very clean, comfortable, light and airy, more than adequate. I would strongly recommend it, although not luxurious but very cozy hotel the best to set next to the fire place to warm-up, we would definitely stay here again. The left (elevator) is available, with nice decent and free breakfast, the staff is VERY friendly at Sint Nicolaas Hotel, the place is very clean and safe, and it's in the best location, By the way, excellent WiFi internet connection inside hotel rooms. What else you need, it is clean, excellent location, free breakfast, free net access, kind and friendly staff. The last thing to mention: safe hotelâ€¦ I left my bag in the storage room for one week, and thx god all was ok when I returned back so I was pleased of sint Nicolas staff.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: collin187
Reviews.Content: Our reservation was made by a secretary. After reading the revieuws on tripadvisor we were scared of what to find! When we first entered the hotel we received a warm welcome! Good impression #1 Rooms were (considering that the builing is more that 300 years old) quite spacious! Good impression #2 Rooms were "new" and clean! Good impression #3 Friendly and helpfull staff, they arranged more that what you would expect! Good impression #4 All considering, more than satisfactory!

Reviews.Title: “not cool”
Reviews.Author: joy1979
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was very disappointing. The room we rented was so tiny we couldnt walk and there were 3 of us. Also it was dirty. The sheets were yellow and the towels looked so dirty that i prefered to air dry. This hotel was not worth the money and very dirty.

Reviews.Title: “single room for â‚¬60”
Reviews.Author: zeetex
Reviews.Content: In Jan '08 while on a business tour to Brussels, when I finally got free from 3 tiring days at the seasonal meetings, I went to the world's freedom capital for just one night... Getting off the Amsterdam central trainstation I just walked past the canal, off the tram lines and straight into the hotel. It seemed small but OK from the outside... I inquired about the rate for a single bed. It was only â‚¬60 which seemed pretty good for a budget traveller that I was by then ;-) The guy at the reception was kind enough to let me have a look inside the room / check amenities first before checking-in. The breakfast was included but I decided to have it out with a friend. The room was rather small but had all basic necessities like hot water shower, safe, phone, cable tv, radiator and a split aircon. The bed was comfortable, the room spotless and the easy chairs by the small full-length window looked quite nice. All in all it was a good find... and nice B&B for just â‚¬60!!! I am surprised to see that now the rate is â‚¬205 per night!!! That's expensive for this small B&B property!!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Kimbo08
Reviews.Content: Located close to Central train Station and city centre. The hotel is comfortable although the rooms are extremely small, the bathroom however was of reasonable size. Friendly front desk staff and above average breakfast. We were only there for one night so cant really offer any further information but would recommend for a stopover when in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly but dirty”
Reviews.Author: Daniel_voyage
Reviews.Content: The location is convenient, just 2 blocks from the Central Station. However, the Hotel is very dirty! when I checked in my room, there were wet socks on the luggage rack and the towels were wet. One had lipstick on them! I thought I entered the wrong room! I returned back to the reception, and asked them to clean the room while I'll go on a tour in the city. When I returned back, nothing was done. I found bread crumbles on the bed and long hair on the pillow. I had to cover everything with my own towels to be able to sleep on. I don't recommend the hotel for professionals or for family. just for young teen agers who don't find a place in a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Super great location”
Reviews.Author: Tuttelut
Reviews.Content: I didn't expect much since it is only a small hotel but I was pleasently surpriced. The hotel had a great location close to the train station and shopping street. The room was nice and clean. We stayed 3 girls in one room and it was spaciuos enough for us. The staff was nice and helpfull. The lobby was nice and I especially liked the fireplace on a cold January day. It was fake but it still warmed. The dislikes are my pillow smelled... and at night it can be quite noisy because of the traffic just outside your window but I got used to it after 1 night. Despite of that I would definitely stay there again if I come back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain hotel in city centre”
Reviews.Author: teekay_cz
Reviews.Content: It's OK for a short stay, and was a real bargain for EUR 65 per night. The hotel is aged and shady a bit, and the rooms are small. But, it's a perfect location, close to Centraal Station and the nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Way too expensive for what it is”
Reviews.Author: eai2007
Reviews.Content: Great location and a very nice looking lobby, besides that it's a bit of a dump. Our room was horrible looking and did not seem all that clean and the toilet smelled. Considering we paid around â‚¬140-150 a night I certainly was hoping for something better. Staff was friendly, but not terribly knowledgeable about the city.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel for a good rate”
Reviews.Author: Bromsgrove-Rover
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Sint Nicolaas last week. The lobby area is beautiful and the staff were courteous, helpful and multi-lingual. The room was nothing like the photos on the website, however. It was more like a youth hostel room, though everything was satisfactory and the bathroom was nice and big. Bring your own washcloth - towels are provided. I enjoyed the breakfast- the coffee was especially good. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Very central”
Reviews.Author: freckledsun
Reviews.Content: This hotel was quite nice and very central. Breakfast is included which was good. The hotel rooms were large enough and clean. Staff were nice, but not overly friendly. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful, but annoying rennovations”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneMatt
Reviews.Content: This hotel was pretty clean, basic room with 3 single beds. There is generally only 1 person at the front desk, so that can be frustrating waiting to get your room key every time you go in or if you've got a question etc. The free wireless requires you to get a 2 hour ticket from reception each time, and generally it only works from reception... i got it working from the room, but it was constantly dropping out. It didn't have a waste bin which was annoying, both in the room or bathroom. They are currently doing some serious renovations, so during the day if you want to sleep it's near impossible with the impact drills going etc... and there is a lot of dust flying around. The staff are helpful and give directions, and bookings etc, but at the moment it's the renovations that killed it for me.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely central place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mummy5
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay in the Hotel Sint Nicolaas and would recommend it to anyone. It was a convenient and easy 5 min walk from Central Station which was wonderful as I was travelling with my 2 children on my own. The staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel had a lift and a luggage store. The latter enabled us to check out on our last morning and leave our bags until lunch time (which allowed us to hop on a tram and have final morning's cycling in the gorgeous and safe Vondelpark - my children's favourite Amsterdam activity). Our room was wonderfully quiet for a European city centre budget hotel. The bathroom was a good size complete with good shower over a large bath. The breakfast came included which was a great bonus in an expensive city and set us up until the afternoon. We had a great choice of cereals (with or without yoghurt), bread, croissants, cold ham, turkey and salami, boiled eggs, fruit, coffee, tea etc and those little packets of chocolate sprinkles that children love to put on their bread for some unknown reason.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: MajorC
Reviews.Content: We spent two separate nights at the hotel, the first one when we arrived in the Netherlands, and the second one on the last day of our vacation (we went on a bicycle tour). Both times we had a triple room, but the quality of the rooms varied dramatically: room 11 was basic but comfortable and clean (the wooden beams even gave it some character). Also, it was quiet, looking onto a side street, while room 16 was very noisy and appeared not to have been cleaned properly. The bathroom door wouldn't close all the way, which might not be a serious problem for a couple, but makes it awkward when it's three people just traveling together who have to share a room. On the plus side, the hotel is really close to the train station, the staff if courteous and helpful, and breakfast is such a wonderful spread as you would expect from a much more pricey establishment.

Reviews.Title: “OK, too hot, but friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: wilees
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for the UK Bank holiday weekend for E160 per night. The location of the hotel is great and the staff were always polite and helpful. Free internet is handy. We stayed on the 4th floor and the rooms looked recently renovated. It was clean and tidy. Completely acceptable for a budget hotel. However, the first day that we were there was very hot and we were unable to cool the room down - even once it had cooled down outside. We had the airconditioning on overnight full but could not get the temperature down to a pleasant level and the staff were not sure how the unit worked (but polite). The breakfast was average European fare and not really worth getting up early for. So the lack of sleep due to the heat is the reason why I have marked down the hotel. After all you are there to sleep. So I would not recommend staying in this hotel during summer.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ceris80
Reviews.Content: After 1 terrible night in The Globe Hotel we had to find somewhere else to stay and we were lucky to come across this hotel. The rooms were very nice and the beds were extremely comfortable. The staff were really helpful and friendly and the location was fantastic too. I'd definitely recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Spot On”
Reviews.Author: Sossage
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with 8 friends, was excellent. Friendly staff, no problem leaving luggage on arrival or departure. Close to amenities.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel kind staff”
Reviews.Author: marymireia
Reviews.Content: stayed here with my husband and daughter for one night on our way to take our daughter to another part of Holland for an international exchange programme. Stayed one night in a triple room (room 21). The position is ideal not 5 mins from the station and very near centre. the room was large enough, warm with a nice bathroom and t.v. Best of all was the kindness of the receptionist on duty morning of 30th January. When I told him one of our large cases had been broken during our flight and if we could call a taxi to get to the station, he told us it was too near to get a taxi but they'd help us. He called a worker who was working on refurbishment in the hotel, who came with a big trolley, walked with us to the station, helped us get the tickets to our next destination, then took us to the platform (carrying the case up the stairs) and put us on the train. We had to force him to take a 3â‚¬ tip (putting it in his pocket). The young man who was very nice and with perfect english was from a country ending in stan (no not Paki or Afghani). I saw this hotel recommended in the Sunday Times and I'd recommend it to anybody

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant value for money”
Reviews.Author: leicslassLeicester
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great value for money. Perfect location 3 mins from Central Station. The room was clean, comfortable, light and airy, more than adequate. Compared to lots of other quotes for hotels, this was considerably cheaper. I would strongly recommend it, although not luxurious, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tirnanean
Reviews.Content: We are a middleaged couple from Ireland who stayed in the hotel for 5 nights at the end of Sept 2006. The hotel is only a 5 minute walk from Central Station. We were in room 34 which overlooked the Nieuwvezijds Voorburgwal on which the trams ran. However the windows were double glazed and the trams stopped before we went to bed. The staff were always most helpful and cheerful. The room, a twin-bedded one, was spacious and well appointed with a good sized bathroom with full bath and shower. There was lots of hot water. The room, was spotless and cleaned every day. The beds were very comfortable. Breakfast was included in the price and was the standard European one and more than adequate. The hotel has a very good elevator. While the only food the hotel supplies is breakfast there is a great variety of restaurants beside it . The hotel is within walking distance of many of the major sights. This is a hotel which we would be very happy to recommend and to which we would return.

Reviews.Title: “A safe haven within a short walk of everywhere”
Reviews.Author: Babyloncraig
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Central Station and only had to walk a very short distance to the hotel, which was good as the traffic reminded me of the old video game Frogger! The Receptionist was pleasant and allowed us into our room slightly before the earliest booking in time. He commented that our room had been newly decorated two weeks prior. On taking the lift to the forth floor the doors opened and we were greeted with a painter on a ladder blocking our exit! Great I thought, however he was polite and moved out of our way and even directed us to our room. The room itself was not exactly large but was more than adequate and the bathroom and shower were excellent. At night time there is noise from the road outside due to the trams, however my wife is a light sleeper and didn't complain about it to much! Breakfast in my opion was a sandwich.... Breads and cold meats. There is cereal available also. The hotel is a great starting point if you plan to walk around the city. My wife complained that I made her walk everywhere! The trams are easily accessable though if you wanted to travel further away from the hotel. By the time we were leaving the painters had completely finished on our floor and the hotel was looking good. All in all the hotel was great and even the tram noise wouldn't put me or my wife off returning. If your after a good reasonably priced hotel to use as a base for dandering around and exploring the city this one is it.

Reviews.Title: “Well Done they saved my holiday”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Sint Nicolaas, is a good basic friendly hotel. It does not claim to be something it is not. After walking out of our previous hotel after one night which claimed to be a 3 star we were very happy with the cleanliness, attitude of the staff, facilities etc. We would stay there again. Well done.

Reviews.Title: “I Agree, This Hotel Has Gone Downhill”
Reviews.Author: FatKitten
Reviews.Content: The first time we stayed at the Sint Nicolaas was in 1999 and I absolutely loved it. The location was perfect, the staff quirky but very friendly and the rooms were basic but clean and large. Since then we have returned to Amsterdam twice a year, always staying at the Sint Nicolaas, and the last couple of times have just not been enjoyable. For our last October trip in we tried a new hotel and will not be going back. There has been a subtle change and it has not been for the better. The decor is looking really shabby but more importantly it just doesn't feel friendly and welcoming any more. I'm sure there has been a management change. The breakfast has changed to self service and the quality is vastly inferior.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Naunie
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Amsterdam and had a delightful experience at the Hotel Sint Nicolaas. This was a last minute reservation, and were happily surprised! The location was perfect - 5 minutes walk from Central Station and 10 minutes to Dam Square, with numerous trams stopping within 1 block of the hotel. The rooms were larger than in most European budget hotels, the bath was huge by comparison, and the buffet breakfast was substantial. We found the staff to be competent and very helpful, and would definitely recommend this one!

Reviews.Title: “Not for light sleepers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night staff at the Saint Nicolaas March 24th. No quads at this hotel, so our family of four needed two double rooms. The staff were accomodating, but as noted in a prior review, they seemed to change daily. Their demand for full-stay payment on check-in should have been a hint. The rooms were very sparse, and the night staff was unable to find towels or soap when requested. The main problem is the extreme noise of this hotel. Five different tram lines run late into the night less than 20 feet outside of the windows. What you gain by location, you lose in amentities and quiet. Unless close proximity to Central Station is your utmost requirement, we reccomend shopping around.

Reviews.Title: “Can't really complain at the price, and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 5 nights staying in this hotel. I paid 60 Euros per night for a single, which is expensive compared to a double but what can you do?? The location is excellent, very close to Central Station and away from the RLD and noisier tourist areas. Close to the Western Canal belt, which I preferred. The room was very basic in terms of the state of the bed, wardrobe, and other fittings, but clean enough, always warm, and you do get a free safe to use. The bathroom was a little damp and sparse, but the bath was massive and the shower worked very well, if set very low down. One major complaint - the noise coming from the main street to the right with trams and buses. The traffic can get very noisy, even with the double glazing. Trams tearing past late at night did annoy me to start off with, but I got used to it until I was awoken at 3am by a tram breaking very hard. The lift is definitely large and modern, ignore the Scots guys comments. The breakfast was pretty basic, but fine for me, and the staff were OK, although it did seem to be someone different every time. This became annoying when they stand at the door and don't let you in when you've been there 4 days already. There's also free internet use, which was great. Overall, a decent enough budget hotel in a very good location - if you can put up with the basic standard and noise on one side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel and will be staying there again next January. If you want a room in Amsterdam for under $100 with an elevator and decent breakfast (free), good luck in your search. The staff is VERY friendly at Sint Nicolaas, the place is kept very clean and safe, and it's in the best location royalty, you won't find it here, but you will find the finest hotel available for under $100 euro. By the way, if you don't appreciate the free breakfast, and haven't been to Amsterdam, you might note that most restaurants in Amsterdam are not open in the morning, and do not serve breakfast at all. It's the effort that matters to me the most, like a free breakfast that don't HAVE to offer it's visitors, and that's what separates Sint Nicolaas from other hotels, they want you to be comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In reply to a negative review I have just read about this charming hotel. I feel it is totally unjustified. I am a regular visitor to Amsterdam (at least 5 business trips a year) & have stayed at the Sint Nicolaas hotel for the last 12 years. The standard of hospitality & friendliness cannot be beaten. This is 1 of the only 2 star hotels offering an elevator and the gentleman from Scotland complains that it is making a loud noise! I suggest that next time he stays in a hotel without an elevator and experience the Dutch steep staircases! The generous breakfast is FREE, which is also unusual in Amsterdam! The staff are very polite and go out of their way to assist. I am perplexed to hear that his experience was negative & can only conclude that this gentleman is perhaps a very unhappy man. I recommend this hotel highly to all my friends & business relations.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at the Hotel Sint Nicolaas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for 5 nights and was very disappointed with this hotel based on the amount it was charging (the same as 4* in Scotland). The rooms were reasonably clean but dull and the bathroom had a bit of damp, and was not always very clean. The breakfast was very disappointing, ham and cheese sandwiches with some butter and jam, every morning. The staff were not particularly friendly. The hotel had an old lift that made a terrible noise, and woke us up every morning as soon as guests started to go for breakfast. The stairs were wooden and old, so also very noisy. I asked to be moved rooms, and was told that I was in the quiet room, as the traffic was noisy on the other side of the hotel. However, the hotel is in an excellent location, only 5 minutes walk from the train station and 5 minutes walk to Dam square, and there was a lovely Chinese/Indianesion restaurant next door to the hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Sint Nicolaas
HotelInfo.Address: Spuistraat 1A, Amsterdam 1012 SP, The Netherlands
